doc.field: PoliceSectors: City of Richmond GIS datasets (Datastack)

This collection (stacked series) of datasets is provided to the UVA Library's Scholars' Lab by the City of Richmond GIS Team / Department of Public Works of the City of Richmond, Virginia, USA, and is provided AS-IS with no guarantees as regards to its accuracy or temporal currency. It pertains primarily to the infrastructure, service zones, and land use within the City of Richmond as well as related natural features. * // * The temporal extent of the datasets in the datastack is generally in the 2007-2008 range, but some datasets may include data that originated earlier. * // * Datasets/Layers included in this datastack (with non-exclusive list of included attributes): * City Boundaries * City Neighborhoods * Planning Districts * Areas and Points of Interest (landmarks) * Buildings and Structures (footprints only) - incl. classification as intact building vs. ruins or foundations. * Street Centerlines - street name, additional geocoding/address matching info. * Street Edges * Regional Streets (extending beyond city proper) - incl. FIPSID, highway or route #s. * Transport Surfaces (incl. roads, bridges, sidewalks) - incl. structural type and surfacing * Parcels (polygon shape) - incl. parcel#, acerage. * Parcel Points (parcel entry/access points) - incl. parcel#, address, additional geocoding/address matching/CAD 911 info. * Parcels (data tables) - incl. parcel#, address, land use, zoning, land and building assessments, building characteristics (age, # of stories), pervious seller, sell date and amount. * Land Use Master Plan - incl. codes and descriptions. * Zoning and Special Use Permit Areas - incl. permit #s. * Historic Districts - incl. name, enactment date and statute. * National Registry Districts * Potential Historic Districts * Enterprise Zones * Commercial Area Revitalization Effort (CARE) areas * Redevelopment and Conservation Areas - incl. classification (1. redevelopment area, 2. conservation area, 3. both R and C, 4. elderly housing, 5. family housing, 6. urban renewal area). * Chesapeake Bay Riparian Protected Areas (RPAs) * 100 and 500 year FEMA floodplains * Elevation Contours - 2 ft. amsl contours. * Urban Forest Canopy Cover * Soils - incl. USDA/NRCS/SSURGO soil classifications and description. * Wetlands - incl. National Wetlands Inventory (NWI) classification code. * Streams and Bodies of Water - incl. type (1. river, 2. lake/pond/reservoir, 3. island, 4. wetland, 5-8 hidden versions of 1-4) * Police Precincts and Sectors * Dispatch Zones * Fire Station Districts * Elementary Middle and High School Attendance Zones - incl. school names. * Voting Precincts and Voting Stations * Congressional Districts * State House and Senate Districts * City Council Districts * 2000 US Census Tracts, Block Groups, and Blocks * Civic Associations * // * More detailed descriptions of the datasets and coding schemes can be found on the City of Richmond's GIS page (see contact info). The additional Parcel data tables can be found via the "extra resources" UVA link provided. * // * These data were made available to the University of Virginia for educational and research uses only. Access is restricted to students, faculty and staff of the University of Virginia.
